facts.subject: English
facts.title: Set for Success!
facts.fact: The word 'set' has the most definitions of any word in the English language, with over 430 different meanings listed in the Oxford English Dictionary.

facts.subject: Maths
facts.title: Pi in the Sky!
facts.fact: The number pi (π) is an irrational number, meaning its decimal form goes on forever without repeating, and it's been calculated to over 50 trillion digits!

facts.subject: Science
facts.title: Bee-ing Busy!
facts.fact: A single teaspoon of honey represents the life work of 12 bees. It takes a bee its entire life to make just one-twelfth of a teaspoon of honey.

facts.subject: History
facts.title: A War That Didn’t Last Long!
facts.fact: The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896. Zanzibar surrendered after 38 minutes!

facts.subject: Geography
facts.title: Time Zone Overload!
facts.fact: Russia is so large that it spans across 11 time zones, more than any other country in the world.

facts.subject: Art
facts.title: A Priceless Heist!
facts.fact: The famous 'Mona Lisa' painting by Leonardo da Vinci is considered priceless, but it was once stolen from the Louvre Museum in 1911 and recovered two years later.

facts.subject: Physical Education
facts.title: Hoola What?!
facts.fact: The longest recorded time someone has been hula-hooping is 74 hours! That’s over 3 days straight of continuous spinning.
